title: Student Activities
content: Students of the Applied Bachelor's in Automotive Engineering Technology program actively participate in various activities that support the development of technical skills and professionalism. They undergo training in automotive laboratories, participate in vehicle design simulations, and engage in industrial practices with leading automotive companies. Students also take part in automotive innovation competitions, seminars on environmentally friendly vehicle technologies, and workshops on technological advancements. Additionally, they are involved in community service activities, such as educational campaigns on vehicle maintenance. Through these activities, students not only deepen their knowledge of automotive engineering but also sharpen innovation and communication skills essential for the professional world.
